Bug Gem.effects:
When held, the Bug Gem increases the power of a damaging Bug-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

description.Black: A gem with an insect-like essence. When held, it strengthens the power of a Bug-type move only once.

Dark Gem.effects:
When held, the Dark Gem increases the power of a damaging Dark-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Draco Plate also changes the type of the move Judgment to Dragon. If held by a Pokémon with Multitype (i.e. Arceus), it changes the Pokémon's type to Dragon.

Dragon Gem.effects:
When held, the Dragon Gem increases the power of a damaging Dragon-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Electric Gem.effects:
When held, the Electric Gem increases the power of a damaging Electric-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Energy Powder restores a Pokémon's HP by 60 points, but also lowers its Friendship level.
Friendship is lowered by 5 points if the Pokémon's current Friendship level is less than 200, or by 10 points if it is 200 or more.

Fairy Gem.effects:
When held, the Fairy Gem increases the power of a damaging Fairy-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Fire Gem.effects:

Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Full Incense.effects:
Full Incense causes the holder to move last within its priority bracket.
In other words, the holder will attack last if all Pokémon use moves with the same priority, but if the opponent uses a lower priority move (e.g. Vital Throw), that Pokémon will still move after the holder of Full Incense.
Full Incense also causes Snorlax to produce Munchlax eggs when left in the Pokémon Day Care holding the item.

Ghost Gem.effects:
When held, the Ghost Gem increases the power of a damaging Ghost-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Grepa Berry.effects:
Grepa Berry increases a Pokémon's Friendship, but also lowers its EVs in Special Defense.
Friendship is raised by 10 points if the Pokémon's current Friendship level is less than 100; by 5 points if it's 100-199; or by 2 points if it's 200 or more.
Special Defense EVs are reduced by 10.

Ground Gem.effects:
When held, the Ground Gem increases the power of a damaging Ground-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Heal Powder.effects:
Heal Powder heals all status problems for a Pokémon (sleep, paralysis, poison, burn, freeze, and confusion), but also lowers its Friendship level.
Friendship is lowered by 5 points if the Pokémon's current Friendship level is less than 200, or by 10 points if it is 200 or more.

Hondew Berry.effects:
Hondew Berry increases a Pokémon's Friendship, but also lowers its EVs in Special Attack.
Friendship is raised by 10 points if the Pokémon's current Friendship level is less than 100; by 5 points if it's 100-199; or by 2 points if it's 200 or more.
Special Attack EVs are reduced by 10.

Ice Gem.effects:
When held, the Ice Gem increases the power of a damaging Ice-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Kelpsy Berry.effects:
Kelpsy Berry increases a Pokémon's Friendship, but also lowers its EVs in Attack.
Friendship is raised by 10 points if the Pokémon's current Friendship level is less than 100; by 5 points if it's 100-199; or by 2 points if it's 200 or more.
Attack EVs are reduced by 10.

King's Rock.effects:
When held, King's Rock gives moves a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch, if the move does not already have an increased flinch chance.
Pokémon with the ability Serene Grace have a 20% flinch chance when holding King's Rock.
The King's Rock also causes the following Pokémon to evolve, when they are traded holding the item:

 -Poliwhirl (evolves into Politoed)
 -Slowpoke (evolves into Slowking)

King's Rock may be found held by wild Poliwhirl, Poliwrath, Politoed, Slowpoke, Slowbro, Slowking, Hariyama, or Hawlucha.

Lagging Tail.effects:
Lagging Tail causes the holder to move last within its priority bracket.
In other words, the holder will attack last if all Pokémon use moves with the same priority, but if the opponent uses a lower priority move (e.g. Vital Throw), that Pokémon will still move after the holder of Lagging Tail.

Luck Incense doubles the prize money received from a trainer battle if the holder takes part. Additional Pokémon holding Luck Incense or Amulet Coin do not further increase the money received.

Moon Stone.effects:
The Moon Stone causes the following Pokémon to evolve:

 -Nidorina (evolves into Nidoqueen)
 -Nidorino (evolves into Nidoking)
 -Clefairy (evolves into Clefable)
 -Jigglypuff (evolves into Wigglytuff)
 -Skitty (evolves into Delcatty)
 -Munna (evolves into Musharna)

Normal Gem.effects:
When held, the Normal Gem increases the power of a damaging Normal-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Poison Gem.effects:
When held, the Poison Gem increases the power of a damaging Poison-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Pomeg Berry.effects:
Pomeg Berry increases a Pokémon's Friendship, but also lowers its EVs in HP.
Friendship is raised by 10 points if the Pokémon's current Friendship level is less than 100; by 5 points if it's 100-199; or by 2 points if it's 200 or more.
HP EVs are reduced by 10.

Psychic Gem.effects:
When held, the Psychic Gem increases the power of a damaging Psychic-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Qualot Berry.effects:
Qualot Berry increases a Pokémon's Friendship, but also lowers its EVs in Defense.
Friendship is raised by 10 points if the Pokémon's current Friendship level is less than 100; by 5 points if it's 100-199; or by 2 points if it's 200 or more.
Defense EVs are reduced by 10.

Razor Claw.effects:
When held, Razor Claw increases the user's critical-hit ratio by one stage (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16, if no other modifiers are in effect).
The Razor Claw also causes Sneasel to evolve into Weavile when held, and Sneasel is leveled up during the night.

Razor Fang.effects:
When held, Razor Fang gives moves a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch, if the move does not already have an increased flinch chance.
Pokémon with the ability Serene Grace have a 20% flinch chance when holding Razor Fang.
The Razor Fang also causes Gligar to evolve into Gliscor when held, and Gligar is leveled up during the night.

Revival Herb revives a fainted Pokémon, fully restoring its HP, but also lowers its Friendship level.
Friendship is lowered by 15 points if the Pokémon's current Friendship level is less than 200, or by 20 points if it is 200 or more.

Rock Gem.effects:
When held, the Rock Gem increases the power of a damaging Rock-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Steel Gem.effects:
When held, the Steel Gem increases the power of a damaging Steel-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.

Tamato Berry.effects:
Tamato Berry increases a Pokémon's Friendship, but also lowers its EVs in Speed.
Friendship is raised by 10 points if the Pokémon's current Friendship level is less than 100; by 5 points if it's 100-199; or by 2 points if it's 200 or more.
Speed EVs are reduced by 10.

Water Gem.effects:
When held, the Water Gem increases the power of a damaging Water-type move by 30%. It is consumed after first use, but is not used if the attack misses.
Only the final type of a move is considered, so moves that vary type (e.g. Nature Power) or moves changed by abilities (e.g. Pixilate) are boosted by the type of Gem the move turns into.
